security_audit.summary: This is a documentation and guidance skill for skill creation. Contains three Python utility scripts for initializing, validating, and packaging skills. The scripts perform standard filesystem operations (directory creation, file writing, zip packaging) with no network access, no credential handling, and no external process execution. All behavior is consistent with stated purpose.

content.user_title: Create Skills for Claude and Claude Code
content.value_statement: Creating skills for AI assistants requires understanding modular design, resource organization, and distribution formats. This guide provides step-by-step instructions for building skills that extend Claude with specialized knowledge and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Follow a 6-step process to create skills from concept to packaged .skill file
Structure skills with proper directories for scripts, references, and assets
Apply progressive disclosure design to manage context efficiently
Use validation scripts to ensure skills meet technical requirements
Package skills into distributable .skill files for sharing
limitations: Does not execute user workflows or access external APIs
Does not provide pre-built skill templates beyond the initialization script
Does not install or manage skills in the AI environment
Focuses on skill creation structure rather than specific domain knowledge

use_cases.title: Build Shareable Skills
use_cases.description: Create modular skills that extend Claude capabilities and can be shared with other users through the skill marketplace.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Package company-specific workflows, coding standards, and domain knowledge into reusable skills for consistent AI assistance.

use_cases.title: Customize AI Behavior
use_cases.description: Design personal skills that encode specialized knowledge, templates, or procedures for recurring tasks.

prompt_templates.title: New Skill from Scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [specific purpose]. Walk me through the 6-step process.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the skill at [path/to/skill] and validate that it follows the proper structure with SKILL.md frontmatter, scripts, references, and assets directories.

prompt_templates.title: Apply Design Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: I am building a skill that supports multiple frameworks. Help me apply progressive disclosure design and organize variant-specific details into reference files.

prompt_templates.title: Package for Distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: I have completed my skill at [path/to/skill]. Guide me through validating and packaging it into a .skill file for distribution.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for processing PDF documents
output: Here is your 6-step plan for creating a PDF processing skill:
1. Define concrete examples: PDF text extraction, form filling, page rotation
2. Plan reusable resources: scripts/rotate_pdf.py, references/schemas.md, assets/templates/
3. Run init_skill.py to initialize the skill structure
4. Edit SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter and workflow instructions
5. Add scripts, references, and assets as planned
6. Run package_skill.py to create the distributable .skill file

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise - include only what Claude needs at trigger time, move detailed documentation to references/
Use progressive disclosure - load reference files only when Claude determines they are needed for the task
Structure reference files with one level depth from SKILL.md and include table of contents for files over 100 lines
anti_patterns: Including redundant information in both SKILL.md and reference files bloats the context window
Creating deeply nested reference directories makes content harder to discover
Using verbose explanations when concise examples would communicate the intent more clearly

faq.question: What AI tools support skills?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Check individual tool documentation for specific skill installation methods.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md body should stay under 500 lines. Reference files can be larger since they load only when needed.

faq.question: How do I integrate skills with my existing workflows?
faq.answer: Skills are loaded alongside the system prompt. They trigger based on metadata description matching the user's request.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skills?
faq.answer: Skills are passive guidance. This skill contains no network access or data collection. Other skills should be audited individually.

faq.question: Why is my skill validation failing?
faq.answer: Check that SKILL.md has valid YAML frontmatter with name and description, the skill name uses hyphen-case, and description is under 1024 characters.

faq.question: How is this different from prompts or commands?
faq.answer: Skills are modular packages with bundled resources like scripts and reference files. They persist across sessions and can be shared with other users.
